question: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)
answer: Object-oriented programming is a way of organizing your program which is to combine your data and functionality in an object.

question: What is the difference between list and tuples?
What are the key features of Python?
answer:
— interpreted (doesn't need to be compiled to run)
— dynamically typed (you don’t need to state the types of variables when you declare them)
— well suited to object orientated programming (allows the definition of classes along with composition and inheritance)
— functions are first-class objects (can be assigned to variables and passed as arguments to other functions)
